page.title: 10LEAH MANNING CENTRE,HARLOW .
page.content: {This centre , which opened in 1980, {provides daycare for the elderly}, especially the frail and physically handicapped . It has a friendly atmosphere and is popular, providing many facilities including meals , healthcare, hairdressing and chiropody as well as games, meetings and talks. Mrs. Catherine Shaw ,having retired and moved from the busy built-up East End of London to live with her daughter in the relatively peaceful greenery of{Harlow}, often arranges to meet her friends there ,where she does ballroom dancing and enjoys reading in the library . Many elderly people also enjoy a mid-day meal there. Situated in the Town Park ,the centre is named after{Leah Manning},the local M.P. who organised welfare clinics in the New Town ,known as "Pram Town" because of the many young families .
